
---
layout: post
title:  'Password-policies'
author: 'jakub.siuda@exceedra.com'
exerpt: >
  How to define password policies that a user would have to conform to in order to change his password 

---

  <p><strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">1. General</span></strong><br />
<br />
Currently we have two places in our application where a user can change his password, which are the login screen (click on the "Forgotten password link") and the settings screen ("second box on the User Profile tab").<br />
<br />
In both cases the procedure of changing the password is quite similar and only differs in the beginning. The user requests and provides a reset code (the Login screen) or provides his old password (the Settings screen) and then the procedure is the same: the user has to provide a new password, confirm it (repeat it) and then click the save button.<br />
<br />
When providing the new password a table with the app's passwords policies will be shown to the user.<br />
<br />
<img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64," /><br />
<br />
To show this table the app calls app.Procast_SP_LOGIN_GetPasswordPolicy with the following xml-in:</p>
<p>
</p>
<pre>&lt;GetPasswordPolicy&gt;
<span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre;">	</span>&lt;User_LoginName&gt;&lt;/User_LoginName&gt;      &lt;- the login of the user that is trying to change his password
&lt;/GetPasswordPolicy&gt;</pre>
As the response the app expects an xml in the following format:
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;PasswordPolicy&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Policy&gt;&lt;/Policy&gt;<span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre;">				</span>&lt;-- the type of the policy describing how the new password will be validated (for the available types check point 2)
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Value&gt;&lt;/Value&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;-- an additional argument for the new password validation
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;PolicyDescription&gt;&lt;/PolicyDescription&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;-- the text that will be displayed to the user below the passwords box
&nbsp; &lt;/PasswordPolicy&gt;
&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<p>
<br />
<strong><span style="color: #ff0000;">NOTE: you can include multiple PasswordPolicy nodes one after another</span></strong><br />
<br />
<strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">2. Creating a policy</span></strong><br />
<br />
Let's say we want to force the user to provide a password that has at least 8 characters. To do so we can provide the xml below:</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;PasswordPolicy&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Policy&gt;MinimumPasswordLength&lt;/Policy&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Value&gt;8&lt;/Value&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;PolicyDescription&gt;Minimum 8 characters long&lt;/PolicyDescription&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/PasswordPolicy&gt;<br />&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<p>
Now, if the user provides a password shorter than 8 characters he won't be able to click on the save button (even if the confirm password is the same as the new password):<br />
<br />
<img alt="" src="/media/Login/PasswordPolicies1.png" /><br />
<br />
However, if he provides a password that is 8 or more characters long he'll be successfully able to save it as his new password:<br />
<br />
<img alt="" src="/media/Login/PasswordPolicies2.png" /><br />
<br />
<strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">3. Types of policies</span></strong><br />
<br />
<strong>3.1 Minimum password length</strong></p>
<pre><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &lt;PasswordPolicy&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Policy&gt;<strong>MinimumPasswordLength</strong>&lt;/Policy&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;PolicyDescription&gt;Message to the user&lt;/PolicyDescription&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Value&gt;&lt;/Value&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;-- provide an integer</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &lt;/PasswordPolicy&gt;</span><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&nbsp;</span></pre>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>3.2 Maximum password length</strong></p>
<pre><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &lt;PasswordPolicy&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Policy&gt;<strong>MaximumPasswordLength</strong>&lt;/Policy&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;PolicyDescription&gt;Message to the user&lt;/PolicyDescription&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Value&gt;&lt;/Value&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;-- provide an integer</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &lt;/PasswordPolicy&gt;</span></pre>
<p>
<strong>&nbsp;</strong></p>
<p><strong>3.3 Can't contain user name</strong></p>
<pre><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &lt;PasswordPolicy&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Policy&gt;<strong>CannotContainUsername</strong>&lt;/Policy&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;PolicyDescription&gt;Message to the user&lt;/PolicyDescription&gt;</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Value&gt;&lt;/Value&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;-- provide 0 or 1 (when 0 the policy doesn't have any effect)</span><br style="line-height: 20px;" /><span style="line-height: 20px;">&nbsp; &lt;/PasswordPolicy&gt;</span></pre>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>3.4 Must contain a specified number of characters from the specified character set</strong><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"></span></p>
<pre>&nbsp; &lt;PasswordPolicy&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Policy&gt;<strong>MustContain</strong>&lt;/Policy&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;PolicyDescription&gt;Message to the user&lt;/PolicyDescription&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Value&gt;&lt;/Value&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&lt;-- provide an integer - how many times a character from the CharacterSet must be contained in the new password<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;CharacterSet&gt;&lt;/CharacterSet&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&lt;-- a set of characters, for example for the upper case letters: ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ<br />&nbsp; &lt;/PasswordPolicy&gt;</pre>
<p>
<strong><span style="color: #ff0000;">NOTE: there are some characters in the CharacterSet that can't be used in their normal form and must be properly formatted, such as:<br />
&amp; must be &amp;amp;<br />
&lt; must be &amp;lt;<br />
&gt; must be &amp;gt;</span></strong></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700; line-height: 20px; font-size: 16px;">4. Password policies guidelines</span></p>
<p>
Check the article "Password policies - guildelines"</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
